data.title: Uncaught Error: Accès refusé./\?\~\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.20.1\resources\app\node_modules\key...
data.body:
The following error just happened at Atom startup. It worked great yesterday, with no apparent change that could justify the new behavior.

A few minutes later, I also experienced #14461 while typing.

What is special on my station? BitDefender blocks apps when they try to access files in "protected" directories. However, this feature is designed to handle white listing nicely: when an app is blocked, BitDefender displays a notification and you can unblock the app. I already unblocked Atom a few days ago. And this time Atom does not display anything about a "fraudulent" access from Atom. So I just mention this point to be comprehensive.


**Atom**: 1.20.1 ia32
**Electron**: 1.6.9
**OS**: Up-to-date Windows 10
**Thrown From**: Atom Core


### Stack Trace

Uncaught Error: Accès refusé.
\\?\C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.20.1\resources\app\node_modules\keyboard-layout\build\Release\keyboard-layout-manager.node


data.title: Atom is unable to open folder with cmd line tool
data.body: ### Prerequisites * [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following: * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/ * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages ### Description On the command line `atom .` is unable to open the project folder in atom successfully. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Open Terminal 2. cd into project folder 3. `atom .` and press enter **Expected behavior:** Atom opens up in a new window (or tab) and loads the project folder as the active folder **Actual behavior:** atom attempts to open a new window, but stays in this state: **Reproduces how often:** 100% ### Versions ``` Atom : 1.21.0-beta1 Electron: 1.6.9 Chrome : 56.0.2924.87 Node : 7.4.0 ``` and ``` Atom : 1.20 ``` ### Additional Information

data.title: Update syntax-related code to use new TextBuffer LanguageMode API (part 1)
data.body:
Refs https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/260

This is the first in a series of PRs to make Atom's syntax related features more flexible.

Currently, code related to auto-indentation and code folding is mostly implemented in a private class called `LanguageMode`, which is constructed with a `TextEditor` instance, and implements most of its functionality by directly manipulating the editor.

This PR removes the `LanguageMode` class and reimplements its functionality in the existing `TokenizedBuffer` class, in a way that does *not* need to manipulate the editor directly. For example, instead of performing folds directly, the `TokenizedBuffer` exposes several pure methods for determining which buffer ranges should be folded.

I converted the `TokenizedBuffer` and its test to JS. For the tests that were previously in `language-mode-spec.coffee`, I have either moved them into `tokenized-buffer-spec.js` or moved them into a new test file - `text-editor-test.js`. I created that new file because I had already converted these tests to JS before realizing that some of them were really about `TextEditor` and not `TokenizedBuffer`, and I didn't want to convert the entirety of `text-editor.coffee` to JS yet. Since the file is so large, we may want to do the conversion gradually.

/cc @nathansobo

data.title: Update language-html to 0.48.0
data.body:
### Requirements

* Filling out the template is required. Any pull request that does not include enough information to be reviewed in a timely manner may be closed at the maintainers' discretion.
* All new code requires tests to ensure against regressions

### Description of the Change

* Fix improper tokenization of script and style tags (where the tags themselves would have embedded scopes)
* Recognize XML namespaces
* Improve attribute tokenization
* Improve entity tokenization
* Add `text/ractive` to list of types that will be tokenized as HTML when in a script tag
* Remove useless `meta.tag.any.html`
* Add unique scopes for the `class` attribute

Other commits are mostly working around the `meta.tag.any.html` removal.

data.title: atom.exe getting blocked by AV
data.body:
Our company's AV is blocking the software since it does not have a valid digital signature. Is it possible for the next released version to be signed? They are saying that it is a security risks without the digital signature and is asking us to look for an alternative software to use.

data.title: Package user reviews
data.body:
### Description

This is more of an enhancement request.
It would be nice to have a review system of packages, that way you can see the quality of the package other than just the number of times it was downloaded

Figured I'd open an issue for it.

data.title: Atom error failed to load config.cson
data.body:
### Prerequisites
* [ ] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * [x] Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * [x] Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Atom error failed to load config.cson, the config.cson unexpectedly contain a lot of white space.
[![IMAGE ALT TEXT HERE](https://img.youtube.com/vi/0c4uI6D2i6w/0.jpg)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0c4uI6D2i6w)

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Cleanup the config.csom white space.
2. Update atom or atom packages. I am not sure which one i did.
3. Open atom, the config.cson contain white space again.

**Expected behavior:** 
Run atom as usual, then i can write some code.

**Actual behavior:** 
It pop up failed to load config.cson with `stdin:1:1: error: unexpected`

**Reproduces how often:**
100%, i update atom or it's packages twice. It does the same error.

### Versions

You can get this information from copy and pasting the output of `atom --version` and `apm --version` from the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.
OS: windows 8 64bit
atom: version 1.20.1 via UI (help-> version)
atom -v: 
```
Atom    : 1.18.0
Electron: 1.3.15
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0
```
apm -v:
```
apm			1.18.1
npm			3.10.10
node		6.9.5  ia32
python	        2.7.11
git			2.14.1.windows.1
visual studio    2015
```
apm ls -i:
```
[36mCommunity Packages (29)[39m C:\Users\x\.atom\packages
├── atom-autocomplete-php@0.25.6
├── atom-beautify@0.30.5
├── atom-ternjs@0.18.3
├── autoprefixer@3.7.1
```

data.title: Atom hangs on changing tab of deleted file
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Atom hangs on changing tab of deleted file

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a file (say foo).
2. Open foo
3. Delete foo.
4. Open another file (say foo1).
5. Try to change the tab using ctrl+tab

**Expected behavior:** 
Atom must not consider the deleted file while changing the tab

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
Atom tries to open the deleted file and atom freezes.

**Reproduces how often:** [What percentage of the time does it reproduce?]
100%

### Versions

atom --version => 
Atom    : 1.20.0
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

apm --version =>
apm  1.18.4
npm  3.10.10
node 6.9.5 x64
python 2.7.10
git 2.11.0

You can get this information from copy and pasting the output of `atom --version` and `apm --version` from the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

### Additional Information

Any additional information, configuration or data that might be necessary to reproduce the issue.

data.title: Git Integration Orange Highlighting Broken
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

In the previous version of Atom, modifying a file would result in its tab and file in the highlighted orange until the next commit. In 1.20.1 x64 (macOS 10.12.6), modifying and saving a file results in it being highlighted orange for about .5 seconds, then reverting back to white.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open a file which has already been committed to git.
2. Modify the file and save it.
3. Watch as the tab and file in the Tree View turn orange briefly, then revert to white.

**Expected behavior:** The file tab and Tree View file should remain orange until the next git commit.

**Actual behavior:** It turns back to white. The issue doesn't also happen for new files, which stay green correctly.

**Reproduces how often:** 100%

### Versions

Atom 1.20.1 x64 with macOS 10.12.6

data.title: Unable to push to GitHub
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

When using the by default installed package "github" to push a commit to my repo i get the following error message:
Unable to push
Git credentials for https://github.com/edvwib/hello-world.git not found:
fork/exec C:/Users/[USER]/AppData/Local/Temp/github-117820-1760-1x4yd44.asem56ogvi/git-askpass-atom.sh: %1 is not a valid Win32 application.
error: failed to push some refs to 'https://github.com/edvwib/hello-world.git'

I'm able to pull and merge changes, but not pushing them.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open a cloned repo in Atom.
2. Make a change and try to push the commit.
3. Provide user/password and receive the message above

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]
Pushing the commit to the repository.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
Throws the error above.

**Reproduces how often:** [What percentage of the time does it reproduce?]
100% of the time.

### Versions

Tested on both Windows 10 V.1709 Build 16288.1 and Windows 10 V.1703 Build 15063.608.
Works correctly on Atom 1.20.0. 64bit
Doesn't work on Atom 1.20.1 64bit or 1.21.0 Beta1 64bit.

atom --version
Atom    : 1.21.0-beta1
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

apm --version
apm  1.18.5
npm  3.10.10
node 6.9.5 x64
python
git 2.14.1.windows.1
visual studio

data.title: Disable extension Docblockr failed
data.body:
When I click the disable button for extension Docblockr，the config.cson is as blow：
    disabledPackages: [
      "script"
      "docblockr"
    ]

When I modify  config.cson  manually as below, the disable button turn to enable button.
    disabledPackages: [
      "script"
      "Docblockr"
    ]

And extension Script have the same problem, I think it's just a case sensitive problem of atom.

data.title: Reopening of tabs from last session not working when relaunching Atom 1.19.6 on Ubuntu 16.04 X64
data.body:
### Description

The re-opening/restoring of tabs as described in https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/9968, https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/1603 and https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/3665#issuecomment-57355820 is not working.

"Preferences>Open Emty Editor on Start" is set to "deactivated"
"Preferences>Restore Previous Windows On Start" is set to "always"

### Steps to Reproduce

1.) Open Atom 1.19.6 on Ubuntu 16.04 X64 from the unity launcher of terminal.
2.) Add a project folder, leave some tabs open, and close Atom via "File>Quit" or clicking on X.
3.) Reopen Atom by double-clicking a file associated with it, outside any project.

**Expected behavior:**

Opening the tabs opened in the last session.

**Actual behavior:**

Atom completely forgets what was last open, and launches with a single window open to double-clicked file's folder, with single tab for the double-clicked file.

**Reproduces how often:**

Always

### Versions

Atom    : 1.19.6
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

data.title: 1.20.0: Popup jump when using macOS Chinese IME
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description
The popup panel will jump from top left corner to the bottom of current line when using Chinese pinyin IME(includes macOS built-in and squirrel and others).

It should keep under the bottom of current line.

### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open Atom (1.20.0)
2. Choose a Chinese IME
3. Try to input something

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5624870/30604864-ef5eee4e-9d20-11e7-8ace-8d6ad21e8558.gif)

You can see more [here](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/14911#issuecomment-330604185) and [here](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/14911#issuecomment-330606144)

**Expected behavior:** The popup should keep under current line, not jump from top left corner.

**Actual behavior:** The popup jump from top left corner when try to type something.

**Reproduces how often:** Every time

### Versions
Atom    : 1.20.0
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

apm  1.18.4
npm  3.10.10
node 6.9.5 x64
python 2.7.13
git 2.14.1


### Additional Information
This issue has already discussed [here](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/14911#issuecomment-330472422)

data.title: Issue when collapsing if blocks
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [ X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

When collapsing a if statement (javascript, C++ ...) Atom collapse also the end bracket even if it present a else statement. This creates problems reading the code.

### Steps to Reproduce

Write a code as: 
if (a == 2) {
  b = 1;
} else if (a == 1) {
  b = 2;
} else {
  b = 0;
}

**Expected behavior:** Collapse should include bracket (as now) if there isn't a else statement on the same line otherwise it should stop at the previous line

**Actual behavior:** Collapse hides the end bracket even if present a else statement creating a unreadable code


**Reproduces how often:** always

### Versions

1.20.1 x64 Windows

### Additional Information

Any additional information, configuration or data that might be necessary to reproduce the issue.
![screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14887677/30630780-417a6458-9de2-11e7-886c-f266e023c32e.png)

data.title: Atom uses unexpectedly large quantities of storage space in a hidden folder
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Atom uses an extraordinarily large amount of disk space in a hidden folder (%LOCALAPPDATA%\Atom under Windows, presumably the same thing happens in ~/.atom under Linux although I haven't tested this).  Usage is apparently increasing without limits over time.

Having had Atom installed for several months, I have the following contents in the given folder (along with sizes and timestamps of most-recently-modified file in each subdirectory):

> 595M    2017-06-16 04:04        ./app-1.18.0
> 582M    2017-08-08 18:13        ./app-1.19.0
> 581M    2017-08-14 22:47        ./app-1.19.1
> 581M    2017-08-17 02:33        ./app-1.19.2
> 583M    2017-08-22 23:14        ./app-1.19.3
> 583M    2017-08-28 19:34        ./app-1.19.4
> 4.0K    2017-08-28 19:33        ./bin
> 1.1G    2017-08-28 19:33        ./packages
> 4.5G    2017-08-30 16:41        .
> 

### Steps to Reproduce

1. [First Step]
2. [Second Step]
3. [and so on...]

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]

Usage is limited and reasonably small, and does not grow boundlessly over time.  Presumably, this means that older versions should be deleted (perhaps retain the current version and the previous version, and deleted anything older than that?  also the downloaded packages could presumably be deleted as soon as they've been installed?)

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]

Disk usage grows boundlessly.  For users trying to run an OS off a modest-sized SSD (e.g. 80GB) the level of usage growth is so large that it will become problematic in reasonably short timespans.

**Reproduces how often:** [What percentage of the time does it reproduce?]

Every time, AFAICT.

### Versions

Versions are as shown in the file dump above.  I'm running on Windows 7 Professional, but doubt it would be any different in other versions.

data.title: Unknown Unicode characters written back as different hex than they are read in as
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [X ] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Unknown Unicode characters written back as different hex than they are read in as.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Have a UTF-8 file with unicode U+0091 in it.
2. Open file in VS code to have it displayed as �
3. Make change somewhere in file other than the hex 91 character and save file
4. Open in notepad++ to see the character is now different as the hex in the file for U+0091 has been rewritten as � (0xEFBFBD) from the 0x91 it was previously.

**Expected behavior:** When you open a file with Unicode characters, U+0091 in particular, it renders as the � character. If you change ANYTHING but that character, and save the file, unaltered character values should not change. When opening in another editor, that supports said Unicode character, it should render it fine. That character value should not be changed on save when the character was never altered during the edit.

**Actual behavior:** When you open a file with Unicode characters U+0091 in particular, it renders as the � character. If you change ANYTHING but that character, and save the file, the hex value for what should be U+0091 is changed to 0xEFBFBD.

**Reproduces how often:** 100%

### Versions

Atom     : 1.20.0
Electron : 1.6.9
Chrome : 56.0.2924.87
Node     : 7.4.0
OS         : Windows 7 Pro

### Additional Information

None

data.title: change activeItemPath when file is renamed
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

When the active file's name is changed the `activeItemPath` is not changed

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open a file
2. Rename the file
3. Type the following command into the developer console:

```javascript
atom.workspace.getActivePane().element.dataset.activeItemPath
```

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]

It should display the path of the active item

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]

It displays the old path of the active item

**Reproduces how often:** [What percentage of the time does it reproduce?]

100%

### Versions

Atom    : 1.21.0-beta0
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

apm  1.18.5
npm  3.10.10

python 2.7.11

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: fileType.toLowerCase is not a function
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce:]

1. just open atom
2. ...but after modifying the config file in probably an inadequate fashion. can't open it anymore...

**Atom**: 1.20.0 x64
**Electron**: 1.6.9
**OS**: Mac OS X 10.12.6
**Thrown From**: Atom Core


### Stack Trace

Uncaught TypeError: fileType.toLowerCase is not a function

```
At /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/grammar-registry.js:90

TypeError: fileType.toLowerCase is not a function
    at GrammarRegistry.module.exports.GrammarRegistry.getGrammarPathScore (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/grammar-registry.js:90:45)
    at GrammarRegistry.module.exports.GrammarRegistry.getGrammarScore (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/grammar-registry.js:64:26)
    at /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-editor-registry.js:321:52
    at Set.forEach (native)
    at TextEditorRegistry.grammarAddedOrUpdated (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/text-editor-registry.js:307:47)
    at Function.module.exports.Emitter.simpleDispatch (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/event-kit/lib/emitter.js:25:20)
    at Emitter.module.exports.Emitter.emit (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/event-kit/lib/emitter.js:141:34)
    at GrammarRegistry.module.exports.GrammarRegistry.addGrammar (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/first-mate/lib/grammar-registry.js:76:26)
    at Grammar.module.exports.Grammar.activate (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/first-mate/lib/grammar.js:254:54)
    at /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/package.js:686:31
    at /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/first-mate/lib/grammar-registry.js:121:61
    at parseContents (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/season/lib/cson.js:123:13)
    at /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/node_modules/season/lib/cson.js:212:26
    at tryToString (fs.js:426:3)
    at FSReqWrap.readFileAfterClose [as oncomplete] (fs.js:413:12)
```

### Commands

```
     -0:22.8.0 grammar-selector:show (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -0:19.8.0 core:confirm (input.hidden-input)
```

### Non-Core Packages

```
autocomplete-python 1.10.3 
compare-files 0.8.1 
emmet 2.4.3
```
